text: Herbert A. and Bettie E. Cress House is a historic home located at Warrensburg, Johnson County, Missouri. It was built about 1888, and is a 1 1/2-story, Queen Anne / Shingle Style frame dwelling. The first-story walls are of weatherboard (beveled siding), and the second-story walls are of sawn shingles. It sits on a sandstone foundation and features a full-width front porch and second story porch. (includes 12 photographs from 1994) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1995. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:Queen Anne architecture in Missouri Category:Shingle Style architecture in Missouri Category:Houses completed in 1888 Category:Buildings and structures in Johnson County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Johnson County, Missouri
title: Herbert A. and Bettie E. Cress House
